comnickdchee.github.a3am.Backend

Class Backend

  • java.lang.Object
    • comnickdchee.github.a3am.Backend.Backend

  • public class Backend
extends java.lang.Object
    Backend class that handles most of the logic required to access data and retrieve data from the Firebase database.

    • Method Detail

      • getBackendInstance

        public static Backend getBackendInstance()
        Get the actual instance of the backend class.

      • addBook

        public void addBook(Book book)
        Add book to the current user model as well as the table. We get the id of the currently added book, and pass it to the actual

      • deleteBook

        public java.lang.Boolean deleteBook(Book book)
        Delete the book from both the books table and every requesting user's requested books list.

      • getCurrentUser

        public User getCurrentUser()
        Returns the current user of the model class.

      • setCurrentUser

        public void setCurrentUser(User user)
        Setter for when we need to change the current user class. Essentially, we want to be able to change the actual user model outside of the backend class if needed, and call update to update the table (see updateCurrentUserData).

      • loadCurrentUserData

        public static void loadCurrentUserData()
        Class that loads all the current user into the user class referenced by the singleton. Note that this is an asynchronous load, so we change the information everytime the information in Firebase changes.

      • getCurrentUserData

        public void getCurrentUserData(UserCallback userCallback)

      • updateCurrentUserData

        public void updateCurrentUserData()
        Update current user data by pushing the current user class to the table. This allows for pushing requested books and owned books into the users table if they ever get updated.

      • updateUserData

        public void updateUserData(User user)
        Updates the data of the user in the "users" table in Firebase.

      • updateBookData

        public void updateBookData(Book book)
        Updates the book data in the books table. Used in the addBook helper method.

      • updateExchange

        public void updateExchange(Book book,
                           ExchangeType exchangeType)
        Updates the current exchange in the Firebase database table when a transaction has been completed (one of borrowing and returning.

      • updateExchange

        public void updateExchange(Book book,
                           Exchange exchange)

      • deleteExchange

        public void deleteExchange(Book book)

      • getExchange

        public void getExchange(Book book,
                        ExchangeCallback exchangeCallback)
        Synchronous method that takes in the book and uses the book id to retain the exchange information.

      • acceptRequest

        public void acceptRequest(User user,
                          Book book)
        Accepts a request from the requester on the activity. This method is implemented in the IOwner interface, and has the following logic: The book gets its requesters list cleared, and the current borrower of the book is set to the user id. Then, the status is updated to be Accepted, and both the book and the requester user data is updated in Firebase.

      • rejectRequest

        public void rejectRequest(User user,
                          Book book)
        Reject request that follows similar logic to accept request.

      • updateRequests

        public void updateRequests(Book book)
        Overwrite the data of the original book with the new data when a user requests a book, and updates this in Firebase.

      • getUser

        public void getUser(java.lang.String uid,
                    UserCallback userCallback)
        Fetches a user's information from Firebase, given their uid.

      • getSingleBook

        public void getSingleBook(java.lang.String bookID,
                          BookCallback bookCallback)
        Fetches a book's information from Firebase, given their book ID.

      • getBook

        public void getBook(java.lang.String bookID,
                    BookCallback bookCallback)
        Fetches a book's information from Firebase, given their book ID.

      • getRequesters

        public void getRequesters(Book book,
                          UserListCallback requestersCallback)
        Gets the current requesters for a given book by retrieving data from firebase using a callback/listener. This is used for the requester activity.

      • getBorrowedBooks

        public void getBorrowedBooks(BookListCallback borrowedBooksCallback)
        Retrieves books that the current user is borrowing at the moment. This is retrieved from the user's requested list. We decided that all the books that the current user is interacting with can be derived from the requested books list (a little bit confusing), but it requires the least amount of work.

      • getLendingBooks

        public void getLendingBooks(BookListCallback lendingBooksCallback)
        Retrieves the books that the user is currently lending out to someone else. The books are collected from the current user's ownedBooks list, and the statuses of these books should only be "Borrowed"

      • getActionsBooks

        public void getActionsBooks(BookListCallback actionBooksCallback)
        Gets the current requested books of the user from the Firebase database. Here, we use a callback object so that once all the data is loaded from the database, we can start populating the recycler view in the front-end. Note that this allows the app to both be asynchronous in terms of getting data when a new change has been fired, as well as not be thread locked.

      • getRequestedBooks

        public void getRequestedBooks(BookListCallback requestedBooksCallback)
        Gets the books that a user is currently requesting.
